When a user visits a /new editor, we need to populate it with blank versions of HTML and JS frames. We fetch them by identifying them with this fixed, precomputed hash of blank frames.


12const BLANK_HASH = 'e3b0c44298fc';


13


Utility function to fetch while bypassing the cache, and with some default options.


16const cfFetch = (uri, options) => {


17    return fetch(uri, {


18        credentials: 'same-origin',


19        cache: 'no-cache',


20        ...options,


21    });


22}


23


This api object provides some utility methods we use to fetch and push stuff to and from the Codeframe internal API.


26const api = {


27    get: path => cfFetch(`/api${path}`, {


28        method: 'GET',


29    }),


30    post: (path, body) => cfFetch(`/api${path}`, {


31        method: 'POST',


32        body: body,


33    }),


34}


35


36const now = () => new Date().getTime();


37


Debounce coalesces multiple calls to the same function in a short period of time into one call, by cancelling subsequent calls within a given timeframe.


41const debounce = (fn, delayMillis) => {


42    let lastRun = 0;


43    let to = null;


44    return (...args) => {


45        clearTimeout(to);


46        const dfn = () => {


47            lastRun = now();


48            fn(...args);


49        }


50        if (now() - lastRun > delayMillis) {


51            dfn()


52        } else {


53            to = setTimeout(dfn, delayMillis);


54        }


55    }


56}

The PreviewPane  is the half-screen pane that shows a preview of the rendered Codeframe, alongside the URL and refresh buttons.


60class PreviewPane extends StyledComponent {


61


62    init(frameRecord) {


Percentage of the editor size that the preview pane takes up.


64        this.paneWidth = 50;


65


We create an iframe manually and insert it into the component DOM, so as to avoid the iframe being re-fetched and re-rendered every time the preview pane is rendered.


69        this.iframe = document.createElement('iframe');


70        this.iframe.setAttribute('frameborder', 0);


71


72        this.bind(frameRecord, data => this.render(data));


73

75        this.handleRefresh = this.handleRefresh.bind(this);


76    }

171    selectInput(evt) {


172        evt.target.select();


173        gevent('preview', 'selecturl');


174    }


175


176    handleRefresh() {


Force-refreshing the preview works by clearing the "last url" fetched, so it looks like the same URL is a new URL on next render.


179        this._lastURL = '';


180        this.render();


181        gevent('preview', 'refresh');


182    }


183


184    safelySetIframeURL(url) {


If the iframe already has content, we want to replace its uri; if not, we want to give it a uri. This takes care of this logic.


187        if (this._lastURL !== url) {




If we simply assign to iframe.src property here, it adds an entry to the parent page's back/forward history, which we don't want. We only want to add to src if the iframe does not already have a page loaded (i.e. when contentWindow is null).


191            if (this.iframe.contentWindow) {


192                this.iframe.contentWindow.location.replace(url);


193            } else {


194                this.iframe.src = url;


195            }


196            this._lastURL = url;


197        }


198    }


199


200    compose(data) {


If we're not rendering from a saved Codeframe from the server but instead rendering a "live" preview, generate a data URI instead and point the iframe to that. Otherwise, just use the URL to the saved preview.


204        let url = '';


205        if (data.liveRenderMarkup === null) {


206            url = `${window.location.origin}/f/${data.htmlFrameHash}/${data.jsFrameHash}.html`;


207        } else {


208            url = 'data:text/html,' + encodeURIComponent(data.liveRenderMarkup);


209        }


210        this.safelySetIframeURL(url);


211


We compare the new URL to the old URL here, to see whether we need to reset the src attribute on the iframe. If it's unchanged, we leave the iframe alone.


214        return jdom`<div class="previewPanel" style="width:${this.paneWidth}%">


215            ${data.liveRenderMarkup === null ? (


216                jdom`<div class="topBar">


217                    <div class="fixed button inputContainer">


218                        <input value="${url}" onfocus="${this.selectInput}" />


219                    </div>


220                    <button class="button refreshButton" title="Refresh preview"


221                        onclick="${this.handleRefresh}">↻</button>


222                    <a class="button previewButton" title="Open preview in new tab"


223                        target="_blank" href="${url}">Preview</a>


224                </div>`


225            ) : (


226                jdom`<div class="topBar">


227                    <div class="unsavedWarning">


228                        tap


229                        <div class="fixed inline button">Save ${'&'} Reload</div>


230                        to share <span class="mobile-hidden">→</span>


231                    </div>


232                </div>`


233            )}


234            ${this.iframe}


235        </div>`;


236    }


237


238}

The Editor component encapsulates the Monaco editor, all file state, and other state about the files the user is editing.


242class Editor extends StyledComponent {


243


244    init(frameRecord) {


Percentage of the editor size that the editor pane takes up.


246        this.paneWidth = 50;


247


Initial values for extra settings


249        this.settings = {




Is the config bar visible?


251            visible: false,




Is the as-you-type live reload enabled?


253            asYouTypeEnabled: true,


254        }


255


The "mode" is a slug, either 'html' or 'javascript', that shows what file we're currently editing.


258        this.mode = 'html';




Frame hashes of the last-saved editor values, to see if we need to re-fetch frame file values when the route changes.


261        this._lastHash = '';




The frames state stores the string contents of both files during editing.


263        this.frames = {


264            html: '',


265            javascript: ``,


266        }


Monaco has the concept of "models" to keep track of state across editing sessions between files. This is where we keep the model (state) of the two files, when they're not actively being edited. This preserves e.g. the undo/redo stack between mode switches.


270        this.models = {


271            html: null,


272            javascript: null,


273        }


274        this.initMonaco();


275


276        this.bind(frameRecord, data => {


277            this.fetchFrames(data);


278            this.render(data);


279        });


280


Any calls to resizeEditor should be debounced to 250ms. This is negligible to UX in fast modern laptops, but has a noticeable impact on UX for lower-end devices.


283        this.resizeEditor = debounce(this.resizeEditor.bind(this), 250);


284        window.addEventListener('resize', this.resizeEditor);


285


We create these two methods that are versions of switchMode bound to specific editing modes, for easier use later on in compose().


288        this.switchHTMLMode = this.switchMode.bind(this, 'html');


289        this.switchJSMode = this.switchMode.bind(this, 'javascript');


290        this.saveFrames = this.saveFrames.bind(this);


291


Bind other methods used as callbacks


293        this.toggleSettings = this.toggleSettings.bind(this);


294        this.toggleAsYouType = this.toggleAsYouType.bind(this);


295


Live-rendering (previewing unsaved changes) should be debounced, since we don't want to re-render the iframe with every keystroke, for example.


298        this.liveRenderFrames = debounce(this.liveRenderFrames.bind(this), 750);


299    }


300


301    remove() {


302        window.removeEventListener('resize', this.resizeEditor)


303    }


304


305    setWidth(width) {


306        this.paneWidth = width;


307        this.resizeEditor();


308        this.render();


309    }


310


311    fetchFrames(data) {


fetchFrames is in charge of (1) determining based on new data whether we need to re-fetch HTML and JS files for the current version of the Codeframe (or if we have it already) and making those requests and saving the results to the view state. We are careful here to first check if the frames we are looking to fetch aren't the ones already saved in the editor.


316        if (


317            data.htmlFrameHash + data.jsFrameHash !== this._lastHash


318            && data.htmlFrameHash


319        ) {


320            this._lastHash = data.htmlFrameHash + data.jsFrameHash;


321            api.get(`/frame/${data.htmlFrameHash}`).then(resp => {


322                return resp.text();


323            }).then(result => {


324                this.frames.html = result;


325                if (this.models.html !== null) {


326                    this.models.html.setValue(result);


327                }


328                this.render();


329            });


330


331            api.get(`/frame/${data.jsFrameHash}`).then(resp => {


332                return resp.text();


333            }).then(result => {


334                this.frames.javascript = result;


335                if (this.models.javascript !== null) {


336                    this.models.javascript.setValue(result);


337                }


338                this.render();


339            });


340        }


341    }

initMonaco is one of the few places in the codebase that directly interacts with the Monaco editor's API. We create a new instance of an editor and start editing the currently selected mode's file.


346    initMonaco() {




We explicitly create a div to contain the editor, since that's how Monaco's editor API works.


349        this.monacoContainer = document.createElement('div');


350        this.monacoContainer.classList.add('editorContainer');


Monaco's production bundle is designed to be consumed using an AMD module loader like RequireJS. You don't need to understand this part.


353        require.config({


354            paths: {


355                vs: 'https://unpkg.com/monaco-editor/min/vs',


356            },


357        });


358        require(['vs/editor/editor.main'], () => {


Initialize models for both files


360            for (const lang of ['html', 'javascript']) {


361                this.models[lang] = monaco.editor.createModel(this.frames[lang], lang);


362                this.models[lang].onDidChangeContent(this.liveRenderFrames);


363            }


364


365            this.monacoEditor = monaco.editor.create(this.monacoContainer);


366            this.monacoEditor.setModel(this.models[this.mode]);


367            this.render();


After the editor renders once, we want to make sure the editor is sized correctly to the containing box. layout() forces Monaco to re-layout itself in the space it was given.


371            this.monacoEditor.layout();


372        });


373    }


374


375    resizeEditor() {


editorInstance.layout() forces the editor to re-size itself.


377        if (this.monacoEditor) {


378            this.monacoEditor.layout();


379        }


380    }


381


382    switchMode(mode) {


When we switch modes, we have to first save the value of the file being edited, then switch out the underlying file model.


385        if (this.monacoEditor) {


386            this.frames[this.mode] = this.monacoEditor.getValue();


387            this.monacoEditor.setModel(this.models[mode]);


388        }


389        this.mode = mode;


390        this.render();


391        gevent('editor', 'switchmode', mode);


392    }


393


liveRenderFrames() is called when the editor content changes, to client-side refresh the iframe preview contents.


396    liveRenderFrames() {


397        if (!this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled) {


398            return;


399        }


400


401        const newEditorValue = this.monacoEditor.getValue();


No need to re-render changes when the editor value is not new. (In fact, because of leaky abstraction around events + immutable state between Monaco and Torus, doing so leads to a race bug.)


405        if (newEditorValue !== this.frames[this.mode]) {


406            this.frames[this.mode] = newEditorValue;


407


408            const documentMarkup = `<!DOCTYPE html>


409<html>


410    <head><title>Live Frame | CodeFrame</title></head>


411    <body>


412        ${this.frames.html}


413        <script src="https://unpkg.com/torus-dom/dist/index.min.js"></script>


414        <script>${this.frames.javascript}</script>


415    </body>


416</html>`;


417


418            this.record.update({


419                liveRenderMarkup: documentMarkup,


420            });


421        }


422    }


423


424    toggleSettings() {


425        this.settings.visible = !this.settings.visible;


426        this.render();


The settings bar changes the editor view size, so we need to re-layout the editor after render.


429        this.resizeEditor();


430    }


431


432    toggleAsYouType() {


433        this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled = !this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled;


434        this.render();


In case there are any current dirty changes when this is toggled on...


436        if (this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled) {


437            this.liveRenderFrames();


438        }


439        gevent('editor', 'settings.asyoutype', this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled.toString());


440    }


441


saveFrames handles saving / persisting Codeframe files to the backend service, and returns a promise that resolves only once all frame files have been saved.


444    async saveFrames() {


445        this.frames[this.mode] = this.monacoEditor.getValue();


446        const hashes = {


447            html: '',


448            js: '',


449        }


This is a nice way to make the function hang (not resolve its returned Promise) until all of its requests have resolved.


452        await Promise.all([


453            api.post(`/frame/`, this.frames.html).then(resp => {


454                return resp.text();


455            }).then(hash => hashes.html = hash),


456            api.post(`/frame/`, this.frames.javascript).then(resp => {


457                return resp.text();


458            }).then(hash => hashes.js = hash),


459        ]);


Once we've saved the current frames, open the new frames up in the preview pane by going to this route with the new frames.


462        router.go(`/h/${hashes.html}/j/${hashes.js}/edit`);


463        gevent('editor', 'save');


464    }

479            border-top: 2px solid var(--cf-black);


480        }

482            display: flex;


483            flex-direction: row;

489            height: 52px;


490            overflow-x: auto;

492                background: var(--cf-background);


493            }


494        }

497            flex-direction: row;


498            align-items: center;


499        }


500        .button {

502        }

507            width: unset;


508            &::before,


509            &::after {


510                display: none;


511            }


512        }


513        .editorContainer,


514        .ready {

532


533    compose() {


534        return jdom`<div class="editor" style="width:${this.paneWidth}%">


535            <div class="topBar">


536                <div class="buttonGroup">


537                    <button


538                        class="button ${this.mode === 'html' ? 'active' : ''} tab-html"


539                        title="Switch to HTML editor"


540                        onclick="${this.switchHTMLMode}">


541                        HTML


542                    </button>


543                    <button


544                        class="button ${this.mode === 'javascript' ? 'active' : ''} tab-js"


545                        title="Switch to JavaScript editor"


546                        onclick="${this.switchJSMode}">


547                        JavaScript


548                    </button>


549                </div>


550                <div class="buttonGroup">


551                    <button class="button ${this.settings.visible ? 'active' : ''}" title="Show additional settings"


552                        onclick="${this.toggleSettings}">...</button>


553                    <button class="button" title="Save Codeframe and reload preview"


554                        onclick="${this.saveFrames}">Save ${'&'} Reload</button>


555                </div>


556            </div>


557            ${this.settings.visible ? (


558                jdom`<div class="topBar">


559                    <button class="button ${this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled ? 'active' : ''}"


560                        title="Turn on or off live-reloading as you type"


561                        onclick="${this.toggleAsYouType}">


562                        Reload as you type


563                        ${this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled ? '(on)' : '(off)'}


564                    </button>


565                </div>`


566            ) : null}


567            ${this.monacoEditor ? this.monacoContainer : (


If the editor is not yet available (is still loading), show a placeholder bit of text.


570                jdom`<div class="ready"><em>Getting your editor ready...</em></div>`


571            )}


572        </div>`;


573    }


574


575}

The Workspace component is the "Codeframe editor". That is to say, this is the component that wraps everything into a neat, interactive page and is the backbone of the Codeframe editing experience.


580class Workspace extends StyledComponent {


581


582    init(frameRecord) {


The left/right panes are split 50/50 between its two panes.


584        this.paneSplit = 50;


585        this.preview = new PreviewPane(frameRecord);


586        this.editor = new Editor(frameRecord);


587


588        this.bind(frameRecord, data => this.render(data));


589


this.grabDragging represents whether there is currently a drag-to-resize-panes interaction happening.


592        this.grabDragging = false;


593        this.handleGrabMousedown = this.handleGrabMousedown.bind(this);


594        this.handleGrabMousemove = this.handleGrabMousemove.bind(this);


595        this.handleGrabMouseup = this.handleGrabMouseup.bind(this);


596    }


597


Shortcut method to set the sizes of children components, given one split percentage.


600    setPaneWidth(width) {




These cases implement "snapping" of panes to 0, 50, 100% increments, with 1% buffer around each snap point.


603        if (width < 1) {


604            width = 0;


605        } else if (width > 99) {


606            width = 100;


607        } else if (width > 49 && width < 51) {


608            width = 50;


609        }


610


611        this.paneSplit = width;


612        this.preview.setWidth(width);


613        this.editor.setWidth(100 - width);


614        this.render();


615    }


616


What follows are mouse/pointer event handlers to make resizing a smooth experience.


619


620    handleGrabMousedown() {


621        this.grabDragging = true;


622        this.render();


623    }


624


625    handleGrabMousemove(evt) {


626        if (this.grabDragging) {


627            if (!evt.defaultPrevented) {


628                evt.preventDefault();


629            }


If the event is a touch event, get the clientX of the first touch point, not the whole event.


632            if (evt.touches) {


633                evt = evt.touches[0];


634            }


635            this.setPaneWidth(evt.clientX / window.innerWidth * 100);


636        }


637    }


638


639    handleGrabMouseup() {


640        this.grabDragging = false;


641        this.render();


642        gevent('workspace', 'resize', 'editor', this.paneSplit);


643    }


644


645    styles() {


646        return css`


647        width: 100%;


648        height: 100%;


649        display: flex;


650        flex-direction: column;


651        header {


652            display: flex;


653            flex-direction: row;


654            justify-content: space-between;


655            align-items: center;


656            flex-shrink: 0;


657            padding: 4px;


658            background: var(--cf-background);


659            border-bottom: 4px solid var(--cf-black);


660        }


661        &.embedded header {


662            display: none;


663        }


664        nav {


665            display: flex;


666            flex-direction: row;


667            flex-shrink: 1;


668            overflow-x: auto;


669        }


670        main {


671            display: flex;


672            flex-direction: row;


673            justify-content: space-between;


674            align-items: flex-start;


675            flex-grow: 1;


676            flex-shrink: 1;


677            overflow: hidden;


678            position: relative;


679            height: 100%;


680            @media (max-width: 750px) {


681                flex-direction: column !important;


682            }


683        }


684        .button {


685            white-space: nowrap;


686        }


687        .newButton {


688            color: var(--cf-accent);


689        }


690        .grabHandle {


691            position: absolute;


692            top: 50%;


693            left: 0;


694            transform: translate(-50%, -50%);


695            border-radius: 4px;


696            width: 8px;


697            height: 56px;


698            background: #fff;


699            border: 3px solid var(--cf-black);


700            cursor: ew-resize;


701            z-index: 2000;


702            &:hover {


703                background: var(--cf-background);


704            }


705            &:active {


706                background: var(--cf-accent);


707            }


708        }


709        .grabHandleShadow {


710            background: rgba(0, 0, 0, .1);


711            position: absolute;


712            top: 0;


713            left: 0;


714            right: 0;


715            bottom: 0;


716            z-index: 1000;


717            transition: opacity .3s;


718            &.hidden {


719                opacity: 0;


720                pointer-events: none;


721            }


722        }


723        .fullButton {


724            display: none;


725        }


726        &.embedded .fullButton {


727            display: block;


728            position: absolute;


729            top: unset;


730            left: unset;


731            bottom: 2px;


732            right: 6px;


733            font-size: .75em;


734        }


735        `;


736    }


737


738    compose() {


739        return jdom`


740        <div class="workspace ${window.frameElement === null ? '' : 'embedded'}"


741            ontouchmove="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMousemove : ''}"


742            ontouchend="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMouseup : ''}"


743            onmousemove="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMousemove : ''}"


744            onmouseup="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMouseup : ''}">


745            <header>


746                <div class="logo">


747                    <a class="button" href="/">Codeframe</a>


748                </div>


749                <nav>


750                    <a class="button newButton" href="/new?from=editor">


751                        + New <span class="mobile-hidden">Codeframe</span>


752                    </a>


753                    <a class="button tiny-hidden" href="https://twitter.com/thesephist" target="_blank">


754                        <span class="mobile-hidden">Made by</span> @thesephist


755                    </a>


756                    <a class="button" href="https://github.com/thesephist/codeframe" target="_blank">


757                        <span class="mobile-hidden">View Source on</span> GitHub


758                    </a>


759                </nav>


760            </header>


761            <main>


762                ${this.preview.node}


763                ${this.editor.node}


764                <a class="button fullButton"


765                    title="Open this editor in a new tab"


766                    target="_blank"


767                    href="${window.location.href}">


768                    Open in new tab


769                </a>


770                <div class="grabHandleShadow ${this.grabDragging ? '' : 'hidden'}"></div>


771                <div


772                    title="Resize editor panes"


773                    class="grabHandle mobile-hidden"


774                    style="left:${this.paneSplit}%"


775                    ontouchstart="${this.handleGrabMousedown}"


776                    onmousedown="${this.handleGrabMousedown}">


777                </div>


778            </main>


779        </div>`;


780    }


781


782}


783


The App component simply wraps around the Workspace to provide routing and a container for the workspace.


786class App extends StyledComponent {


787


788    init(router) {


This frameRecord becomes the view model for most views in the editor.


791        this.frameRecord = new Record({


792            htmlFrameHash: '',


793            jsFrameHash: '',


794            liveRenderMarkup: null,


795        });


796        this.workspace = new Workspace(this.frameRecord);


797


Routing logic.


799        this.bind(router, ([name, params]) => {


800            switch (name) {


801                case 'edit':


802                    this.frameRecord.update({


803                        htmlFrameHash: params.htmlFrameHash,


804                        jsFrameHash: params.jsFrameHash,


805                        liveRenderMarkup: null,


806                    });


807                    break;


808                default:


809                    router.go(`/h/${BLANK_HASH}/j/${BLANK_HASH}/edit`);


810                    break;


811            }


812        })


813    }


814


815    styles() {


816        return css`


817        width: 100%;


818        height: 100vh;


819        display: flex;


820        flex-direction: column;


821        overflow: hidden;


822        `;


823    }


824


825    compose() {


826        return jdom`<div id="root">


827            ${this.workspace.node}


828        </div>`;


829    }


830


831}


832


833const router = new Router({


834    edit: '/h/:htmlFrameHash/j/:jsFrameHash/edit',


835    default: '/new',


836});


837


Create a new instance of the editor app and mount it to the DOM.


839const app = new App(router);


840document.body.appendChild(app.node);


841


Since the editor is a full-window app, we don't want any overflows to make the app unnecessary scrollable beyond its viewport.


844document.body.style.overflow = 'hidden';


845
